Well-known as a cult classic for a reason.
"You idiot! Stepping on the sand brings antlions!"

Mostly holds up after all this time, 17 years on. Interesting from a historical view, as this game was on the turning point of FPS games, and features a 90s floaty style of gunplay, and the player can carry a dozen different weapons and needs health packs to heal. The game also includes a number of physics puzzles, which are a bit of an oddity, as that never really became part of the genre. The Player as Gordon Freeman is also completely silent, from a time where this was common. However, Halflife is at the point where the NPCs will actually comment on Gordon's stotic silence.

Un Juego Atemporal que toda persona de llamarse a si misma "Gamer" Deberia Haber Jugado.

Every time I play it, I can't believe it's from 2004.
That's the thing all the greatest games have in common. They transcend the time they were made in, and when you go back and play it you find out that everything still holds up. It's the same feeling I got with GTA:SA, Burnout 3, Gran Turismo 4.
